description: Welcome to The Hill's Business & Economy newsletter {beacon} Business & Economy Business & Economy   The Big Story  Swalwell blasts referral for alleged mortgage fraud The Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA) has reportedly made a criminal referral for Rep. Eric Swalwell (D-Calif.), sending information to the Justice Department accusing him of mortgage fraud. ©...
title: Another Trump critic faces mortgage fraud claims

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: The hemp industry is regrouping and gearing up for a significant lobbying blitz following passage of the government funding package that contained a provision they say would outlaw nearly all hemp products.  The legislation clarifies the definition of hemp to ban all hemp-derived products containing THC, which were legalized by the 2018 farm bill.  Legal...
title: Hemp industry plans next move after Trump signs THC ban

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: Welcome to The Hill's Defense & NatSec newsletter {beacon} Defense & National Security Defense & National Security The Big Story  US military kills 4 in 20th strike on alleged drug boats The Pentagon earlier this week carried out its 20th strike on a boat it claimed was trafficking drugs, killing all four on board, officials...
title: US military kills 4 in 20th strike on alleged drug boats

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: A quarter of American households are living paycheck-to-paycheck, according to a new analysis from Bank of America.  Slow wage growth has contributed to an increase in households with limited savings. Lower-income and middle-aged households bear the brunt of rising costs. The number of middle-aged households living paycheck-to-paycheck have increased compared to Gen Z and traditionalists...
title: 24 percent of households living paycheck-to-paycheck: Analysis

author: Addy Bink
description: If you've got a retirement plan, you'll be able to save more in 2026.
title: You'll be able to save more for retirement in 2026 as IRS updates 401(k), IRA limits

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins on Thursday said Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits will be restored in full by Monday.  “We, immediately last night, began moving out, making sure that the program continues unabated, starting once the government reopened, and hopefully by the end of this week, most will receive it at the very latest...
title: Agriculture secretary: Full SNAP benefits to be restored by Monday

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: U.S. Catholic bishops voted to officially ban Catholic hospitals from performing gender-affirming care for any transgender patients.  Wednesday’s vote to update the “Ethical and Religious Directives for Catholic Health Care Services” will have significant impacts on patients across the country, though most Catholic institutions don’t currently offer gender-affirming care.  More than 1 in 7 patients...
title: US bishops ban gender-affirming care at Catholic hospitals

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Jim Avila, a veteran reporter for ABC News, died this week after a long illness, the network reported on Thursday. Avila, 69, reported for marquee ABC News programs like "20/20" and "World News Tonight" during his decades-long career with the broadcast network. He covered some of the biggest national stories during his time in front...
title: Former longtime ABC correspondent Jim Avila dies at 69

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Longtime cable news host Chris Matthews said Democrats’ “snobbery” had compelled working-class voters to support President Trump and Republican-leaning candidates. Matthews joined MSNBC’s “Katy Tur Reports” to promote his new book, “Lessons from Bobby: Ten Reasons Robert F. Kennedy Still Matters,” and he was asked about the enduring lessons Democrats can take from the man...
title: Chris Matthews: Democrats' 'snobbery' drove away working-class voters

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The Justice Department is on the hunt for someone who attempted to “confront” Alina Habba, the acting U.S. attorney for the District of New Jersey, after entering her office. “Last night, an individual attempted to confront one of our U.S. Attorneys — my dear friend @USAttyHabba — destroyed property in her office, and then fled...
title: Habba confronted by individual, property in office destroyed: Bondi

author: Tara Suter
description: An airline trade group is pushing for a “long-term solution” to protect air travel in a future shutdown, with the recent closure of the government resulting in aviation chaos over the last few weeks. “We implore Congress to ensure future funding bills do not allow aviation to become collateral damage in Washington’s policy debates,” Airlines...
title: Trade group calls for 'long-term solution' to protect air travel in future shutdown

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: If we want to get serious about manufacturing in America — and be less reliant on imports from foreign country — then we need to build things here, and we are going to need skilled labors to do it. That includes skilled immigrants.
title: Trump destroys Laura Ingraham on H-1B visas; America needs talent

author: Tony Kurzweil
description: Residents near the Palisades and Franklin fire burn areas are being asked to use Thursday to get prepared ahead of the storm, which is expected to arrive later in the evening before the heaviest rain falls on Friday.
title: Evacuation warnings issued ahead of Southern California storm

author: Corey Kvasnick, opinion contributor
description: America says it wants to be tough on crime. But instead of solving murders, we’re funding deportations. Instead of clearing rape cases, we’re building detention centers.

description: Millions of customers, current and former, were impacted by a pair of data breaches.

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: An opinion drafted over the summer by the Department of Justice argues servicemembers who participate in boat strikes in the Caribbean cannot be prosecuted – one of the many concerns expressed by critics who have questioned their legality. Details of the July opinion, first reported by The Washington Post, come as lawmakers have expressed scrutiny...
title: DOJ argues US military personnel cannot be prosecuted for drug boat strikes

author: Judy Kurtz
description: Sharon Osbourne is thanking President Trump for leaving her family a voicemail praising Ozzy Osbourne as an "amazing guy" in the wake of the heavy metal performer's death. "I just wanted to wish you the best and the family," Trump said in the message played on an episode of "The Osbournes" podcast, released Wednesday. "Honestly, he was...
title: Sharon Osbourne shares Trump voicemail after Ozzy's death: 'An amazing guy'

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: All Smithsonian museums that were closed due to the government shutdown are expected to reopen on Monday.  The Smithsonian's website said all of its "museums, research centers and the zoo" remain closed Thursday. “The National Museum of American History, the National Air and Space Museum, and the Steven F. Udvar-Hazy Center will reopen on Friday,...
title: All Smithsonian museums expected to reopen by Monday

author: Jos Joseph, opinion contributor
description: Jennifer Lawrence has questioned the effectiveness of celebrities speaking out against President Trump, while the Democrats should focus on the economy and the struggles of everyday Americans, rather than relying on out-of-touch celebrities to deliver their message.
title: Democrats must finally divorce Hollywood

description: Vice President Vance on Wednesday praised supporters of the so-called “Make America Health Again” movement, saying they are “asking the right questions.” In a panel discussion alongside Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr., the leader of the “MAHA” movement, Vance described his wife, second lady Usha Vance, as “probably one of...
title: Vance: MAHA crowd 'asking the right questions'

author: The Hill Staff
description: Former Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-Calif.) and Democratic members of the House Sustainable Energy and Environment Coalition will speak with reporters Thursday morning about rising threats of climate change with the United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP30) underway. COP30, an annual conference that allows world leaders to share their climate goals and initiatives, began last week...
title: Watch live: Pelosi, House Democrats give remarks on COP30, climate change

author: Robert Klitzman, opinion contributor
description: Understanding that we are in fact undergoing psychological processes of grief can help us cope and respond as effectively as possible.
title: 5 stages of grief for US democracy

description: President Trump’s installation of a loyalist prosecutor who brought cases against two of his political adversaries will be scrutinized by a federal judge Thursday in a pivotal hearing that could cut her tenure short. U.S. District Judge Cameron Currie is tasked with deciding whether Lindsey Halligan, the interim U.S. Attorney for the Eastern District of...
title: Comey, James challenge Lindsey Halligan’s appointment as top prosecutor

author: Julia Manchester
description: Community organizer Katie Wilson was projected to defeat Seattle Mayor Bruce Harrell (D) in the city’s mayoral race, according to Decision Desk HQ, in a major win for progressives.  Like New York City’s mayoral contest, Seattle’s election was seen as a battle between progressives and establishment Democrats. The race came down to the wire, with vote-counting stretching out over...
title: Progressive Katie Wilson ousts Democratic incumbent in Seattle mayor's race

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Thomas Massie (R-Ky.), who is leading the effort to force a vote on the full release of the files tied to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, said he is hopeful the number of Republicans backing the measure “could snowball.” “I’ve already had a couple Republicans tell my office privately that they’re going...
title: Massie: Number of Republicans voting to release Epstein files 'could snowball'

author: Colin Pascal, opinion contributor
description: Practically speaking, the redistricting competition is a loser for Democrats.
title: Democrats can and should win without partisan redistricting

author: The Hill Staff
description: The federal government starts the process of reopening on Thursday after a record 43-day shutdown ended. President Trump signed the House-passed funding measure bill late Wednesday. Six Democrats voted with Republicans to end the shutdown. Many federal workers will start receiving paychecks on Saturday. But both the U.S. air traffic system and federal food assistance...
title: Live updates: Government reopens after 43-day shutdown

author: Andrew Dorn
description: Auto loan delinquencies among subprime borrowers just hit a record high in data going back to 1993.
title: Late car payments hit record among subprime borrowers

description: According to the survey, 97% of participants could not tell a difference between clips of AI-generated and human-made music.

description: That claim does not stand up to scrutiny.

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Sen. John Fetterman's (D-Pa.) new memoir details a souring relationship between him and Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro (D), particularly over the governor's approach to criminal justice. In "Unfettered," Fetterman described an "ugliness between us — from which we have never recovered," Axios reported. He said he saw Shapiro as someone with "political ambition" who sought...
title: Fetterman in memoir: Relationship with Shapiro devolved into 'ugliness'

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Wednesday signed a government funding bill to officially end the longest shutdown in history after 43 days. Trump signed legislation in the Oval Office, where he placed blame for the shutdown on Democrats while surrounded by Republicans lawmakers and other GOP officials. “Today we are sending a clear message that we will...
title: Trump signs funding bill to end historic government shutdown

author: Sudiksha Kochi
description: Six House Democrats on Wednesday crossed the aisle to vote in favor of a funding measure aimed at ending the longest government shutdown in U.S. history. The Democrats provided a cushion for Speaker Johnson (R-La.) to get the measure across the finish line after two House Republicans — Reps. Thomas Massie (R-Ky.) and Greg Steube...
title: These six House Democrats voted with Republicans to end the shutdown

author: Mike Lillis
description: The House on Wednesday passed a sweeping spending package to reopen the government, setting the stage to end a marathon shutdown — the longest in U.S. history — that churned economic turmoil around the country and sparked an internal battle among Democrats over the future of the party and how best to take on President...
title: House passes bill to end history-making shutdown, sending it to Trump

author: Ryan Mancini
description: A federal judge on Wednesday ordered the release of more than 300 people detained by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) during "Operation Midway Blitz." The order came after U.S. District Judge Jeffrey Cummings ordered the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to release 13 people detained in Illinois and held in Texas, Missouri and other states....
title: Judge orders more than 300 ICE detainees released by next week
